info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 04 at 12:08PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...CONTINUED VERY COLD TEMPERATURES AND SOME SLICK ROADS EXPECTED TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING... Black ice will remain a potential hazard again tonight. Many locations are expected to reach above freezing this afternoon and any melted snow or ice will refreeze tonight, causing some roads and bridges to become slick into early Saturday morning. Untreated parking lots, and sidewalks that have not completely dried out will also be at risk for ice. Motorists should exercise caution by slowing down and increasing following distance. Very cold temperatures are expected again tonight into Saturday morning with lows in the teens and wind chills in the single digits. Prepare for the cold weather by protecting pipes, plants, pets, and checking on the vulnerable.
